Summary: We picked this one close to shopping area and Disneyland not bad price but carpet felt wet walking barefoot. Perfect view of the Disney fireworks ! We would stay again if the prices is right. Rooms were small and no microwave or refrigerator .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of six stayed here in two rooms for three nights in June whilst visiting Disneyland.  From check-in to departure, every single member of staff was friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean and beds comfortable, although quite small.  The complimentary shuttle service to and from Disney was consistent, reliable, and punctual, which is more than I can say for other services offered by resorts closer to the park entrance! The drivers were all friendly, but we'd like today a special thanks to Ray, who not only took us to and from the Park safely, but was really entertaining, taking time to tell some jokes and teach our kids a cool magic trick too!  Warm cookies at check-in are a small token, but a lovely treat and completely delicious. Had I not been on a diet, I'd have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok stay at the Double Tree
Summary: Well first impressions kind of scared me, however it turned out to be ok.  Let me explain.  We arrived at 1:30PM they checked us in early without hassle as check in was at 3:00PM  The first hour in our room I noticed that the toilet did not stop running, the fridge made a horrible noise when the compressor kicked in(loud enough that you could not ignor it) so I tried to phone down to the front desk and one of the two phones was not working (arrrh) Oh yea the safe was locked in the open position....We wanted to get to DL so I called down and asked for someone to come and fix our safe I was told 5 minutes...we waited 1/2 hour and I called back to find out no one was coming, it took another 10 minutes for someone to come.  We shut off the fridge and that day someone fixed our
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my third stay at doubletree and I typically stay here for business. the hotel is located in a centralized location near the outlet mall. I have more cons than pros:  Pros: Safe location and easy to get to Very nice front desk staff  Cons: I am a HHonors Gold and was upgraded to a secured concierge floor. I got into the elevator and hit the16th floor button without entering my key card, not so secure..My room was out of date, wallpaper pealing off the walls and the carpet was sticky when walking barefoot. I went to the 20th floor to look for the concierge (there are signs and arrows for concierge) and found out there is not a concierge lounge. I called down to the front desk about dinner reservations and they said their is a concierge desk downstairs that can help with
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this hotel on a few occassions going to Disneyland and a few weddings. Front desk staff friendly. Quick check-in. Used hotel self-parking and was charged a daily rate. A few miles from Disneyland, but the offered shuttle service to the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Needed a place to stay for a weekend for a basketball daycamp my daughter was going to...  I bid on a 3 1/2 star hotel on priceline, and this is what I got this past weekend. After staying at this hotel, I really have to question priceline's rating system, because this doubletree deserves 1 1/2 *at the most*. It was so awful, I checked out after one night despite having paid for the entire weekend. I'll be honest that due to my disgust and hasty departure, I can't speak to more of their amenities. In any case, this was my experience...  My daughters and I were placed in a wheelchair accessible room (ie bathroom that looked like a dirty gym's locker room) which was unacceptable to begin with, but Jonathan at the front desk was friendly and apologetic, and I was just too tired to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We won this hotel on Priceline for a great price for a 6 night stay for our Disneyland trip. It is a little farther away then where we normally stay but it didn't matter to us.  This was our first time staying here and they didn't treat us any differently because we booked our room through Priceline which I have expierenced before at different hotels.  When we got here my husband went in to check in while I stayed in the car with the kids.  He came out really quick holding the famous warm chocolate chip cookies, one for each of us and they lived up to it's reputation!!  We had a lot of luggage since we were staying for so many nights (3 at a previous hotel) but our bell man (Brandon I think was his name) loaded all of our stuff and the cart was really full and took it up to our
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family have stayed here numerous times over the last couple of years.  Close to angel stadium, free Disney shuttle, and my wives favorite chocolate chip cookies!  I have never had any problems here.  There is a charge for parking and Internet, or I would rate it higher
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Willing and helpful staff, good location, excellent stay.
Summary: Finally a hotel staff that knows the meaning of service.  From the time I pulled in to the time I left.  The staff makes this place better.  The bellhops greeted me every time I entered and exited the hotel.  The front desk promptly answered any questions with a smile and a cookie!  I wanted to mention Jonathan and Viviana they were especially helpful.  The hotel was clean, we stayed on the third floor in the corner a perfect location for our family stay.  The bed was very comfortable after a day @ the beach.  Self parking was very close to the front entrance. ($13/day for self parking)  The pool is fairly small, but there is tennis courts and a basketball court on site.  If in the area again I will be back for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Never stay here!!!!! 1 star is too high!!!
Summary: I checked into this hotel for work. I was placed in a smoking room at 5pm when I checked in. I asked to please be placed in a non-smoking room, as I had booked a non-smoking room. I was told the hotel was sold out for the night but, if they had any cancellations they would let me know. I tried to connect to the internet in my room...only to find the server was down. I left for an extended dinner, checked with the desk after dinner to see if I could be moved to a different room. I still was told the hotel was sold out for the night. What a terrible stench in my room...without windows that actually open as I was told. Reason...customer safety? How many hotels are out in the world with opening windows. When I called the desk and asked if I could be switched to a sister property, I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Loud, felt like I was in the inner City
Summary: I was on the 9th floor and I could hear a ton of noice outside and coming from the floor above. The lobby was super cold. We accidentally thought we were booked at the other Doubletree in Anaheim and that lobby was warm and inviting, the lobby at this Orange location was stark and cold.  The warm cookie at check-in was excellent and much appreciated!  I probably will not stay here again but instead at the other location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you must stay in Anaheim or Irvine CA this is a great location. There is a large amount of outlet shopping within 5 miles in an outdoor mall from the hotel. You are across the street from the Crystal Cathedral which you can tour or visit for a service.   You are essentially walking distance from some of the outpatient UC Irvine hospital clinics.  The Anaheim Angels ballpark is quite close and can be seen quite large through the upper floor windows.    The rooms are comfortable. I have no complaints.  The lobby is large and there are restaurants for dinner or breakfast.    The best part of this hotel are the warm fresh cookies they offer all guests upon arrival. Very nice touch.    This is a good choice.  I will say that there are no really close higher end non chain
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We were happy to read the warm cookies at checkin made a difference and that your room was comfortable. We definitely look forward to welcoming you back to your next stay with us.

Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at.  The customer service is excellent.  The room was great.  The free shuttle to Disneyland was perfect for visiting the park.  I don't think I would stay anywhere else on our next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: We are so flattered that you decided to write such a nice review about our hotel. Thank you very much for taking the time to do so! The team looks forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We stayed here for a three day trip to Disney and California Adventure.  We stayed in one of the suites, and it was very nice.  The only complaints I have is that there was no breakfast and the fact that they gouge you on the Internet.  Two drinks in the bar was over $20.  But this is SoCal, so I guess I have to come to expect it.  Good location and not a bad place, overall.
Manager Response: Let me start by saying Thank you! We appreciate you taking the time to review our property. Your review is very sincere and it helps us better understand what our guests needs so thank you for that. Please be assured that your feedback with regards to the internet and breakfast pricing were forwarded to the team.  We hope that if you visit our beautiful city again you’ll choose Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim as we’d love to have you!

Summary: This was our third stay at the hotel and it was just as good as previous visits. The hotel is a good size--not so big that you feel swamped but sufficiently large that you have the facilities you need. It's a nice thing that the staff remembered us from our last visit a year ago and we were amazed that our breakfast orders from previous days were remembered. It is also walking distance to Disney and to the local shops (get the bus back from the park in the afternoon as it gets hot). Staff are really pleasant and attentive. No reservations about recommending this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for visiting us again! We're so happy to read that you thoroughly enjoyed your Doubltree by Hilton Anaheim  experience! We certainly strive to provide you with the best service possible and assure you that you will continue to see this as your continue to visit us!   The team looks forward to your next visit with us.

Summary: The service at this hotel is great and is in a great location. Near Disneyland, a large mall, restaurants, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim Trip Advisor page! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and that the service and location exceeded your expectations. Thank you for choosing our hotel and we definitely look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: A Great Disney "Good Neighbor" Hotel Choice
Summary: We have Disneyland passes and travel frequently from No. Calif. to the area to visit.  This trip (July 2 & 3, 2012) was a last minute excursion to see the new Cars Land at Disneyland.  The night before we left, I contacted Doubletree and was able to get a good rate for one night.  I picked this property because they offer a FREE shuttle to Disneyland.  It departs the hotel every hour on the hour and departs from the park fifteen minutes after each hour.  (It takes only 8 minutes or so to get to the park.)    Check in was lightning fast (pun intended).  We pulled into guest parking lot at 2:45 p.m.  My kids begged to go directly to the park.  So, I ran in to check in and we were able to hop onto the 3:00 p.m. shuttle.  (That's fast check in)    We did not see our room until we
Manager Response: Let me start by saying Thank you! We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  Your kind words have forwarded to the team as I know they will be delighted to hear they made a difference to your stay.  We hope that if you visit our beautiful city again you’ll choose Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim as we’d love to have you! All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: We are annual members at Disneyland and spend alot of time in Orange County. We found this hotel to be close in proximity to all the areas we visit. Also, free shuttle to Disneyland. Parking is a little excessive = Self Park $13 or Valet $16.  Rooms were very clean along with the hotel overall.    Starbucks Coffee Shop not very good. Not there usual good pastries. Bad selection of donuts brought in from the local donut hole somewhere. Will not say anything more about that.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We were happy to read how convenient our location was for you as well as the convenience of our complimentary Disney Shuttle.  We definitely look forward to welcoming you back to your next stay with us.   All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: There are two Doubletree Hotels in Anaheim. One next to Disneyland and this one which is located a couple of miles away next to the Outlets at Orange Mall and the UC Irvine medical center. Overall the hotel is in excellent shape, the room I had was fairly spacious for two and had a nice if smallish window overlooking the Medical Center and mall. I got the room for 4 days at USD 75/day via priceline. My reason for travel was an athletic tournament hosted at the Anaheim Convention Center close by Disneyland. At first I thought to park the car and take the hotel shuttle which runs every hour on the hour to Disneyland and the Convention Center. I soon abandoned that idea and just took the hit in parking fees to drive. Traffic in the area is light during most of the day as long as
Manager Response: Let me start by saying Thank you! We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  We hope that if you visit our beautiful city again you’ll choose Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim as we’d love to have you! All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary Heading: Close to Disney (but not too close)
Summary: We stayed three nights last week at the hotel.  We are Hilton Honor Gold members, so we had upgrades, including a free continental breakfast.  We were there on personal business, that didn't involve Disneyland, but did eat in Downtown Disney a couple nights.  The hotel is actually in walking distance to Angel Stadium, across the street from the UC Irvine med center, and a 5 minute walk to an adjacent outlet mall, with plenty of restaurants.  What the hotel didn't have was all the tumult usually associated with the hotels closer in to the Parks.  Lot's of parents with kids, and tour groups, but not nearly in the numbers that are in the Disney Hotel district.  The Doubletree is also no further than an extra 5 minutes to the parks,than the offsite resort hotels.  The continental
Manager Response: Let me start by saying Thank you! We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  Your kind words expressed on our Valet team and hotel have been forwarded to the team.  We hope that if you visit our beautiful city again you’ll choose Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim as we’d love to have you!  All the best,  Jennifer Phenix Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: Reserved a room with two double beds. Arrived exhausted after our day in Disneyland, to find that they were overbooked! Our family of four ended up sleeping on a sofa bed, a roll-away, and a couch...better than nothing we thought...but all were extremely uncomfortable and provided us with very little sleep. To their credit, we were comped a free breakfast and parking...but we were too tired the following morning to appreciate those gestures.
Manager Response: It is with our sincere apologies that we reply to your message. We will be sharing your review with the team so that we can look into ways of eliminating these kinds of issues for our guests. We do appreciate the time spent to reflect on your experience and hope you do visit us again in the future!   All the best,  Jennifer Phenix Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: Let me start out by saying that I am still in the hotel in their business centre while I write this review. I thought the hotel was fantastic. I was not sure what to expect because of some of the reviews and also a little nervouus as I booked this hotel through Hotels.com. We arrived and had a wee problem at check in but the moment the front desk manager whose name was Peti heard she came over and fixed it right away. She is an asset to this property because of her warm personality and her teriffic people skills.  The entire staff at the front desk was fantastic including Laura and Jonathan who last night were trying to find if the Euro Cup finals would be shown on ESPN. This determined if we stayed to watch..Go Italy!,  or if we headed to San Diego, our next stop in our 10 day
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim Trip Advisor page! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and that the team exceeded your expectations. We will definitely pass on this note to Jonathon and Laura as they both will be thrilled to know they helped make a difference to your stay. Thank you for choosing our hotel to and we definitely look forward to your next stay with us.    All the best,  Jennifer Phenix Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary Heading: Good Stay for trip to Disneyland
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is the free shuttle to Disneyland, It leaves from the hotel and goes straight to the main entrance of the park. No other stops. This is the most convenient transportation to DLR available. The shuttle is clean and on-time. The drivers are friendly. As other reviewers have noted - it is a bummer that you have to pay for wireless internet service and I truly wish that this policy would change. Honestly - how much does it cost to provide wireless internet? Ummmm - NOTHING! Parking at the hotel is expensive, too. But we never rent a car when we are there. We take a cab from SNA to the hotel. Then use the shuttle to the park and back to the hotel. The rooms are all clean and well appointed. The front desk staff can be friendly - or not so much -
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We were happy to read that our complimentary Disneyland Shuttle helped make a difference and that our drivers were friendly. We definitely look forward to welcoming you back to your next stay with us  All the best,  Jennifer Phenix Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: There wasn't anything wrong with my stay, but I was expecting more... For example, you have to pay a considerable amount for parking, have to pay for internet per day, If I'm paying a couple hundred dollars for a room in a business hotel, I expect all of these things to come with my hotel stay.   The next thing I had a problem with is when I was checking in, no one told me able my complementary breakfast I had ordered special. So i had to ask, they told me where it was and I figured that was the end of it. The next morning i proceed to the breakfast room in the back of the restaurant, where the waitress asks me for my complementary coupon. I said I never got one, she told me I needed one in order to get into my free breakfast. So I walked back to the front desk, waited in line
Manager Response: It is with our sincere apologies that we reply to your message. We will be sharing your review with the team so that we can look into ways of improving our processes.  We were disappointed to read of your checkin experience and appreciate your patience while the breakfast coupons were being issued.   We appreciate the time spent to review our property and look forward to your next stay with us.   All the best,  Jennifer Phenix Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: First off the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially concierge! If we go back to Disneyland we would definately stay here again. We booked direct through Hilton online and received one night free...that ended up being $125/night with taxes. You can sometimes get for cheaper through Priceline.com.  Positives about this hotel...away from the Disneyland strip so is quieter and not as many children. Hotel does free shuttle to the strip on the hour. Has restaurant, lounge, Starbucks all on main floor where you can also access free internet. Outdoor pool...didn't actually use it so can't comment. We upgraded our room, cost extra $7 that included continental breakfast for 2 that was well worth the upgrade however room was nothing special but clean. Beds were very comfortable!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your busy schedule to share your experience at the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim.  We are so thrilled your stay was enjoyable.  Rest assured, your feedback and comments have been passed along to our team and they will be happy to hear they helped make a difference. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: This was my third stay at this property and chose it due to the proximity to Angels Stadium. As a gold member I was given a high floor room on the 19th floor which is my usual request. Benefits for Gold and Diamond members are free internet, plus vouchers for continental breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Yes, the parking fees are a bit high but are unavoidable. Another reviewer stated the nearby Hilton Suites having free parking- no longer factual. They charge as well ($11 a day). Hilton does not grant perks to Honors members who book stays on third party sites ( Priceline, Hotwire) at their properties. Overall this Doubletree does is average at best. They gave the property a bit of a facelift but still could use some work.
Manager Response: none

Summary: To start off, my stay was for pleasure, therefore my review is mostly based on this aspect.  The Hotel is goof for business but too bland for Disneyland or fun getaway. Even for business, atmosphere is a bit stale for me. Pros:  *Lobby/Lobby Bar/Restaurant have been renovated and look business sleek and modern. *Clean/Quiet Rooms *Friendly Front Desk/Valet Staff  Cons: Parking Fee: $10+/Day This is not a high traffic area, so paying for parking seems like a way for the Hotel to stiff you with additional fees.  The Hilton Suites across the freeway has free parking. :/?? Pool: Horrible!! I was hoping to cool off and enjoy the sun.  The pool is tiny, old, dated and surrounded by tall pine trees that block most of the sun.  I literally walked out and walked back in. Atmosphere:
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property is well kept and in a convenient location. I have stayed here before and always liked the service, amenities, etc. The restaurant is better than most hotel restaurants. However, I was very disappointed when I checked in that, because I had made my reservations with Expedia when I booked my flight, I was not considered to be a Hilton Honors guest. This meant that the upgrades I usually get at this same location were not available, not even a fridge or mini bar. They offered to get me one if I paid a daily rate. Nothing I said could persuade them that I had always had the Hilton Honors and this would be a virtual downgrade for me. The room was on a lower floor, no newspaper, no special honors treatment. If I had not had these goodies before I would just have
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had stayed at this hotel over 2 years ago.  This time we were visiting families in Orange County, so busy most of the time, and did not have time to benefit from all the hotel amenities.  However, it was a pleasant and comfortable stay.  Likes:  comfortable king bed with crisp white linen, we got an upgraded room with free internet and continental breakfast (enough choices for a hearty breakfast, "fresh" fruit - I have been at some hotels, even 5* ones, where the fruit were stale and not fresh)  Acceptable:  medium pressure shower, thick towels, business centre to print out boarding passes  Nothing I disliked.  I just want to make a general observation that some years ago when I first joined tripadvisor, not many hotels took notice of the reviews.  These days some hotels have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but nothing really unexpected
Summary: Typical doubletree hotel. Nothing really different from any of the other Doubletrees. The cookies were indeed wonderful! Service was quite nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just checked in and despite having three more nights here, I had to write this review. First off, we booked through Priceline and received this room for less than 40% of the normal rate. Despite that the front desk was more than accommodating and upgraded our double room to a king on the 18th floor. I told them we were celebrating our 19th anniversary and they gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. Diana was so sweet to wish us a happy anniversary that way.   We checked the room inside and out. We flipped the mattress, checked under the sink and behind the toilet, we even checked the pillows and this place is immaculate. That made me happy. On top of it all there is a complimentary robe in the closet and a safe.   The location is fantastic. It's only 10 minutes from
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim Trip Advisor page! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and that the team exceeded your expectations. We will definitely pass on this note to Diana as she will be thrilled to know she helped make a difference to your stay. Thank you for choosing our hotel to help celebrate your 19th wedding anniversary.  We definitely look forward to your next stay with us.    All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: My experience at this hotel has been superior than any other from start to finish.  From the friendly staff to the perfectly kept hotel rooms, this place gets 2 very enthusiastic thumbs up.  Dianna at the front desk was a HUGE help with a couple of non-hotel related issues I had, and Pablo in the restaurant was just a JOY to get to know.  Great rates, great value, great food...just great everything!
Manager Response: Let me start by saying Thank You! We appreciate you taking the time to review our property.  Your kind words have forwarded to Diana and Pablo as I know they will be happy to hear they made a difference to your stay.  We hope that if you visit our beautiful city again you’ll choose Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim as we’d love to have you!  All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: Stayed here on an overnight business trip. Nice, spacious lobby with courteous personnel at the desk. Quick check-in, although neither of my keys worked first time. The desk agent quickly re-coded them and they worked fine Rooms look new, very clean. The bed was very comfortable, and I would never have known other people were in the hotel, it was so quiet. Very enjoyable stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay here.   When we arrived we were given 2 warm cookies which really sets the tone for the whole stay.   The room is very comfortable. It's on the same road as Disneyland. It is a bit further down than other resorts.  It's about a 15 mins walk to Disneyland. But for the price this is great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We were happy to read the warm cookies at checkin made a difference and that your room was comfortable. We definitely look forward to welcoming you back to your next stay with us.    All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary Heading: Our Base Hotel From Now for Disneyland!
Summary: Coming from Hilton Irvine, we checked in in the morning around 10:30 (just checking if room is available for we were told early AM check in before 11 AM cost additional $25/room. I booked this hotel at Priceline (my second time to book for their name your own price) for around $55/night with taxes and fees a bit over $70 which is a good deal on Saturday weekend.So they have a room available, check in was a breeze, staff are very helpful. We were on the 5th floor. I thought that was not a nice spot because you see nothing, but lo and behold, come night time, you can see the Disneyland fireworks! We had a double room (again, super comfy beds), with flat screen tv, coffee maker (although there is a Starbucks at the Lobby), NO FRIDGE/MICRO ,  I think thats standard for Hilton,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This hotel is not a Four Star
Summary: I was a bit disappointed by this hotel since it was portrayed as a four-star hotel.  I must say that the staff was very friendly.  The hotel seemed very dated-walls in hallways were marked up.  I did ask the desk if there was a phone charger I could use.  I was told that the engineering department would be contacted.  Never heard back.   This isn't a horrible stay, just not the value that I paid for.  No luxury here.
Manager Response: It is with our sincere apologies that we reply to your message. We will be sharing your review with the team so that we can look into ways of improving.   We were happy to read that the team was friendly and helped in your experience. We do look forward to your next stay with us.  All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: This is a slightly older hotel hence the lower review. The staff was friendly and helpful; however, the rooms had a stale well used smell to them. They were not as clean as I would have liked with some stains on the comforter. That being said, we got a great government rate here and we were able to take the shuttle to and from Disneyland. The only bummer on the shuttle was that it only left every hour from the hotel. But, the drivers were super nice and helpful. All and all a good deal.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to write about your experience.  Your feedback has been forwarded to the operations team to review in detail the guest room concerns as well as the Disney shuttle times to see if amendments can be made.  We appreciate your feedback and do welcome you back to the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim in the near future.   All the best, Jennifer Phenix, Guest Satisfaction Manager

Summary: we have been hilton honors members for years. We were not very impressed with our room. Just before we went to bed we turned on the ac and our room began to smell like dirty feet. We let the front desk know and they moved us which I appreciated but was disappointed because we were given a cheaper room verses what we had paid for.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had two rooms stayed one night service outstanding and clean rooms. Bell hopes could not do enough to help you. Recommend. Off the path from Disneyland but worth the added 5 minutes...
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were in California to celebrate my cousin's wedding (which was held in the hotel). We received excellent service from the time we checked in til the time we checked out! Anytime we called about the wifi to asking for a extra cot for the room, everyone was extremely helpful. What a classy hotel and we would stay there again and recommend this hotel to everyone! Perfect location, close to Disneyland and walking distance to the outlets (my favourite)! Great job Double Tree Hilton!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Warm welcome on our trip to the "Happiest Place on Earth"
Summary: Our trip to Disneyland with our daughter, son-in-law, and two granddaughters could not have started off better!  We were warmly greeted at the front desk and made to feel so very welcome (of course, the delicious chocolate chip cookies helped as well after our long road trip!)  We had booked an additional night after our original booking and so there was a little confusion about that, but, I believe his name was Rick, handled it graciously and assured us that we would not have to move out of our rooms for our second night stays.  The adjoining rooms we had booked were clean and comfortable.  Can I say how much we loved the beds and assortment of pillows?  We received an upper level room per my request and had great views out our windows.  The next morning we caught the first
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was immaculately clean.  The beds were very comfortable.  The rooms are nicely appointed with large flat screen tvs, microwaves & refrigerators.  The water pressure was excellent!  The free shuttle to the park was very convenient.  The only disappointment was they seemed to run out of the signature cookies - and a day later, still no cookies....  Overall - an excellent stay for an amazing price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great price with nice surprises
Summary: We got a great off season rate last minute for a spontaneous Disneyland trip. The hotel has free shuttles all day to the park. When we arrived I noticed lots of high school kids (part of a choral exhibition at Dland) but the hotel had already upgraded our room, moving us several floors above the teens. Despite them and lots of Disney-bound families, the hotel maintained an adult sense of calm and relaxation.  The grounds are small but well set up with firebird next to a large landscaped pond, pool and hot tub, bar and restaurant onsite (we ate at the park but this seems handy since not much is nearby without driving). Best of all - Starbucks in the lobby while you wait for the shuttle. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Service was excellent and you can buy Dland tix at the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to convention center and Disney
Summary: Stayed here for three nights while attending an event at the convention center.  Very nice hotel, staff very friendly and helpful.  litterally around the corner from the convention center and on main strip for Disney (walkable).  Less congested than staying at the Hilton connected to the convention center, but close enough to go back and forth to hotel.  Rooms are suites, well appointed.  Only complaint is the typical poor hide-a-bed matress.  Nice pool area.  Didn't eat at the hotel, but lots of restaurants nearby.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Okay, I am a frequent Disney goer. I have stayed several places in anaheim. From the Doubletree hotel anaheim to the anabella (sucked), main Hilton hotel (not too great), econo lodge (poorer times), ramada, penny saver, sheraton (both locations were good) and of course magic carpet and magic lamp (yes from earlier times). Please note that now that we are more grown up, we have frequented nicer hotels like Fairmonts. Now, on to this particular Doubletree. We have mixed feelings of this hotel because we have had some better stays and some way worse. The property is nice with a nicer pool area and a nice lobby, bar area. That being said, the rooms are decent enough (no coverlets!!) My husband got a deal once with his company and the hotel put us in a horrendous room to "punish us"
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nothing special for gold member and very rude attitude
Summary: I picked this hotel was because of the gold status we have and we paid the published price.  To our disappointment, we didn't get upgrade, no cookie and no discount on parking.  We got free breakfasts but had to pay for kid's. We were told the hotel was full house, indeed it was very crowd, a tattoo conference  was going on (conference room was across the lobby) and long line at the counter.  The staff was busy. When we asked for discount for parking since we didn't get upgrade for gold, we were told "everybody pay $13", and the attitude was very rude .  That's totally lie as there are at least two reviews here mentioned either got free parking for the gold status or paid $7 just for asking. (I didn't read all the review, just the recent few).  I even told them about I read on
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for one night because we were going to the Angels game.  The stadium is about 25 minutes away by foot.  We did not get chocolate chips cookies when we check in :0(. The room was an average size with two double beds.  The hotel was very close to the Block outlet.  The only thing I didn't like was the $13.00 for parking...seems kind os expensive.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, clean, inexpensive, and cookies
Summary: My little family of four just returned from this hotel yesterday.  We booked it just a couple of days before going there because of a quick decision to go to Orange County for Easter Weekend.  I was surprised by of couple of things.  I thought I was definitely underbidding on the hotel on priceline when I put $55 per night.  But, I actually received a room at this hotel for that rate.  I was also surprised when I arrived there to find the hotel in a great location right off of I-5 and 22 freeways.  The hotel is very nice.  Clean is what I'm all about, as you can tell from my other hotel reviews.  I'm not a fan of the 'traditional' or older hotels.  I want my rooms newer, cleaner, more modern, etc.  So, this hotel fits the bill very well. The warm cookies they hand out upon
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice stay but if for business think twice
Summary: The property and room were both fine as was the location for my meetings.  The staff was very friendly and appeared well trained.  A lot of visitor were for Disney since it is so close.  However, Hilton Honors members get key access to higher floors, I think keeping families different lower levels.  However, I think this hotel is watching thier budget too closely.  If you need strong business support, this is not the hotel for you.  Examples from my stay.  I arrived on a Sunday afternoon and they are doing renovations with the room above.  It was hard to focus on my presentation.  However, when I called the front desk they did said they would move my room. I didn't have time to move.  They should have taken some rooms off line nearby.  I took a break late in the day and called
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lobby is Beautiful and  comfortable.  Check in Staff was wonderful with a couple exceptions. When we drove up we were offered no help with our bags  even though there were 4 bell men milling around the front of our hotel.  We were not even offered a luggage trolley. We were left to strugle with our luggage all the way to our room. The hotel also charges for parking $13 per day.  It just chaps my hide.  I hate to pay for parking.  The parking attendants were rude when exiting the lot even though we paid and you had to hand them your receipt to exit the lot.  The rooms were very clean.  The shampoo, conditioner and lotion was upscale.  Very nice big TV but remote was hard to operate.  No free breakfast at hotel however Starbucks is right across the street along with Wendys.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everytime I go to Disneyland I stay in Anaheim. This time since Anaheim was so expensive I stayed in Orange, CA. (10min away). It wasent bad. It was a great hotel with a starbucks inside the hotel.They also have a free shuttle to Disneyland which is the reason why we booked this hotel. I had 4 rooms total and the only dissapointment was that I was unable to get the rooms together not even in the same floor. But otherwise everything else was great. The Block (outlet area) was great. The second day we stayed there it rained so we went to dave and busters which was less than a mile from the hotel. Overall it was a great hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with 162 kids on choir tour. The hotel staff went above and beyond, they were amazing. Hotel was clean, quiet. Beds were very comfortable. Location for me personally was not close enough to disneyland, they do have a free shuttle. Close to a great mall with a theater and bowling alley and of course shopping !
Manager Response: We are very thankful for being able to host your choir group; I have to say your group was great and a pleasure to have. Our "Sweet Dreams" beds are ones to look forward to after a long day. It is definitely a plus not having to pay for transportation to the Disney Parks as our guest. Again thank you for your wonderful comments and we look forward to having you as your guest in the near future. Kind Regards, Victor Gonzalez, Director of Rooms & Guest Services

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay.... for the right price
Summary: Booked this room on hotwire and got an amazing price, so we were already happy campers.  Upon check in, they gave us warm cookies (they know me so well) and earned points there.  Parking wasn't that convenient.  The lot in front of the valet area was pretty full the whole time we were there and we were there during the "off" days of Monday-Thursday.  We got a trainee to check us in, so it took a really long time.  The payoff for our patience was connecting rooms with our friends, which worked out perfectly.  The accommodations were nice, they met the Hilton standards imo.  The beds were comfy, room was clean and the pool was always empty.  Overall, i can say i really liked this place.  Not too far from Disneyland, but without all the hustle and bustle of being nearby.  I would
Manager Response: We believe it’s the little things that make a difference, like making sure you receive connecting rooms and that our warm Doubletree welcome cookie is always waiting for you at the desk during your . Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience you experienced as a result of there being no parking in our main lot. Thank you for being patient with us and being a part of developing one of our new team members. We look forward to having you as our guest in the future and as a gesture of good will I will be more than happy to extend our standard parking rate for valet so you will not be inconvenienced on your next stay if our parking lot is full. Regards, Victor Gonzalez, Director of Rooms

Summary: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel as I was visiting some friends in the area. My room was on the top floor with views of the city. It was nice to relax in bed with a bath robe as their bed was super comfortable! The hotel is very close to shopping at the Block at Orange, which has great shops and some other dining options.
Manager Response: We do have some wonderful views from the Disneyland in the West, Crystal Cathedral to the South, Angels Stadium to the North, and to our picturesque Mountains in the East.  Our city has a lot to offer and we are glad you where able to take advantage of the many amenities we have to offer. Thank you for being our guest and please feel free to contact me when you want to stay in one of our newly renovated rooms to experience a different view from your room.  Regards, Victor Gonzalez, Director of Rooms

Summary: The staff was wonderful. From the front desk to the room service staff. The room was very nice, comfortable and clean. I travel a lot so checking in, even into 3-4 hotels is nerve racking, because you never know. I've Paid $150+ for a room and been very disappointed. I am never disappointed here
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your loyalty to our property. I have shared your review with our team and they are delighted that our commitment to guest satisfaction is reflected in your choice in making us your number one hotel.  We look forward to extending the courtesies you have known to experience in your future stays.  Kind Regards, Victor Gonzalez, Director of Rooms & Guest Services

Summary Heading: Courteous Service & Convenient Location for Business Travel
Summary: Showed up with no reservation since the hotel I booked was oversold. Petty at the front desk was really helpful and quick with check in. Since I am Hilton Gold, she gave me an upgraded room, free self parking, bottled water, and a breakfast voucher that could also be used at the Starbucks kiosk.  I ordered room service for dinner and delivery was very prompt. Food was standard hotel room service.  There was some noise from the freeway, but not enough to keep me from sleeping well!  Overall I would stay here again for business in the area. Convenient, clean an courteous!
Manager Response: We are happy that you discovered us and we were able to accommodate you so quickly and efficiently. Peti is a superstar and she prides herself in delivering that exceptional service, she sends her gratitude to your loyalty with the Hilton Family.  I regret that you did not have the rest you deserve when staying with us.  In the future we have many options to make sure you are away from any potential noise disturbances. When you book your future stay please feel free to contact me directly so we can assure that you receive a restful night sleep. Thank you for choosing the Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim – Orange County . Kind regards, Victor Gonzalez, Director of Rooms & Guest Services.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a business meeting.
Summary: Very comfortable rooms and great view of Disneyland and Crystal Cathedral. Ordered room service for breakfast and it was very good and fast service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Attended the annual Packard convention this past week. Room was great, 16th floor, mini-fridge and micro, Crystal Cathedral view. Everything spotlessly clean. Bed super comfortable. Great sized room. Only suggestion was that the easy chair could have had an ottoman, been much nicer for reading the morning paper or watching a bit of TV. Breakfast at the restaurant was either menu or buffet, I tried both and they were fine. Discounted parking, $3 both because of Hilton Honors and convention attendance was nice. They accommodated the group well although banquet food could have been better. Lots of staff to deliver it and everyone friendly.  The convention has been held there for many, many years and they evidently appreciate the business, how many hotels let you park old cars in
Manager Response: Thank you so much it was truly a treat to host your convention, the automobiles are simply awesome.   I agree being able to put your feet up after a long day is relaxing, let us know next time you are staying with us and we will put the request in to have an ottoman delivered to your room, for your loyalty it’s the least we could do. We look forward to having you as our guest in the near future and can’t wait for next year’s show. Victor Gonzalez Director of Rooms & Guest Services Direct (714) 634 7153 | Fax (714) 978 3839   DoubleTree by Hilton Anaheim - Orange County 100 The City Drive Orange, CA 92868

Summary Heading: Good but don't get a room by the elevator
Summary: Stayed for a conference at UCI medical center- great location across the street.  Clean lobby, friendly staff.  Food in the restaraunt  average and expensive.  Make sure you check the hotel map and do not get a room near the central elevator- my room shook with each up and down of the elevator.  My room was xx26.  Parking and internet seemed expensive to me- see other reviews.  Nice outlet mall nearby.  Crystal Cathedral within walking distance and pretty neat to see up close.
Manager Response: I would like to offer my sincere apology for the less then enjoyable stay you had at our hotel  I realize how disturbing it must have been to be bothered by the sound of elevators. While I do not believe that there is anything that can be done to change this condition, I have found that some guest have more sensitivity to this type of disturbance. Had it been convenient, we would have gladly helped you move to another room.  Believe me, the comfort of our guest is our highest priority.  Please contact me so I may update you’re file so that in future visits you will be accommodated in a room more to your liking.   It is important to me that we attempt to restore your faith in us. If you would be kind enough to contact me I would be happy to make special arrangements for your next visit. This is done as a gesture of our regret, and in the hope that we might regain your confidence and positive attitude towards us.  Regards,  Victor Gonzalez Director of Rooms & Guest Services Direct (714) 634 7153 | Fax (714) 978 3839 DoubleTree by Hilton Anaheim - Orange County 100 The City Drive Orange, CA 92868

Summary: We stayed at this hotel after getting a really great rate from Priceline.  The location is within walking distance to the Orange Outlet mall.  There is a $13/day charge for parking and $12/day for internet.  The staffs were friendly and accommodating. The pool is heated and have on site laundry machines.  The rooms were a good size, but the beds  seemed small and were not very comfortable. The business center is very good and did not charge for printing unlike most other hotels. Overall, I would rate this hotel as average, it met our expectation but was nothing exceptional about it.
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for sharing your experience with us I am always happy to see our guest enjoy our amenities.  I apologies you did not get the rest you deserve clearly, a comfortable bed is a fundamental service you should expect at any hotel. I want you to know that we do have a program of regular mattress replacement and box spring inspection in force. I realize how inconvenient it would have been to move to another room in the middle of the night, but if this would have ensured a better night’s sleep, our staff would have been glad to help to make this change in an expedient manner. The comfort of our guests is of primary importance to us.   I am happy to announce we will be undergoing a room’s transformation here in the near future which will take us from average to exceptional. If you would like updates on our progress I would be happy to be in touch with you to get you the latest and greatest room.  Regards, Victor Gonzalez Director of Rooms & Guest Services Direct (714) 634 7153 | Fax (714) 978 3839 DoubleTree by Hilton Anaheim - Orange County

Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree at Christmas to visit family in the area. The staff was very friendly and efficient and the cookies delicious. We asked to have some extra items in our room and they were promptly delivered. The room and bathroom was spacious, and the two desk chairs along with an regular chair offered plenty of seating. Our King bed was fairly comfortable but as with most hotels the pillows are too small and too mushy. The towels and toiletries were very nice and the room was very clean. We didn't hear much noise from the hallway or the room next to us. It is very convenient, easy walking distance, to a shopping center with a large movie theater and many restaurants. We will stay here again.
Manager Response: We thank you for choosing The DoubleTree by Hilton Anaheim-Orange County,  during your Holiday travels; we hope you enjoyed our Holiday decorations in our lobby during your last stay. We are glad you enjoyed our warm Doubletree Chocolate Chip and Walnut cookies they are the best. We take pride in making sure our guests are taken care of promptly and efficiently and I am glad by your comments we were able to deliver.  Since you are a big fan of our cookies I would like to send you a tin of our famous cookies at your convenience please feel free to contact me at the number provided below. We look forward to your future stay.  Kind Regards,  Victor Gonzalez Director of Rooms & Guest Services Direct (714) 634 7153 | Fax (714) 978 3839 DoubleTree by Hilton Anaheim - Orange County 100 The City Drive Orange, CA 92868

Summary Heading: Decent enough and walkable to various bars and shops
Summary: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago. Its nothing special but standards are ok, rooms are large and it caters for most needs. Only reason I stay here is that its walkable (2 mins across the car park) to the many shops and bars at the Outlets at Orange so you don't have to be confined to the hotel. This is good as the prices being charged for various food items in the hotel are rather dear, $20 for some cereal and a coffee!!!! Your having a laugh.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We needed one night to rest for travel before starting our Disneyland vacation. We used a third party site and ended up at Doubletree for a good rate. Overall the hotel is in nice shape. The staff was very courteous. Pros: The room was pretty big compared to other hotel rooms in the area.  The view out of the window was nice. Large flat screen tv I was really impressed with the bathroom. The water pressure was great and the bath products were crabtreee and evelyn.  Cons:We arrived the week of the NAMM convention. Since they were hosting Fender they had the lobby decked out with lights and guitars,etc. I did not appreciate the giant tower of skulls because it terrified my 5 yr old daughter. They could have been more tasteful in my opinion because people of all ages will visit the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good property for an overnight stay
Summary: My family and I stayed here for one night during a visit to Disneyland. We arrived and used valet parking, which was convenient for us given the situation with my young children and all of kiddie equipment and supplies when traveling with toddlers.  Check-in went smoothly, we received our chocolate chip cookies (delicious!) but we arrived just after a large group of high school students who beat us to the elevator. Once we arrived at our room, the bellman arrived with our luggage. He also retrieved a crib for us.   The room is very basic and institutional compared to other Doubletree properties I have stayed in the past. Yet, it was clean and functional, and had a comfortable king size bed. The desk area was functional and had enough light from the lamp to actually work. The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: nice hotel,friendly staff and easy to find food...
Summary: this hotel located 10 minutes from Disneyland and they have a regular shuttle to disneyland,you can check at concierge about their timing.. staff of this hotel is very friendly and I also like microwave in their room which is very very useful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No frills, no refrigerators, no free WiFi, basically a place to sleep.
Summary: First off, I have never written a hotel review before, but this place has irritatef me so much - I had to, and I have a couple of days left of my stay.  If you only want a place to lay your head near Disney, the Honda Center or Angels Stadium, and outlet shopping; this is your place. Expect nothing else though.   No refrigerator to keep perishables or keep drinks cold. I asked for one but was essentially told they are not available on my floor. Apparently staying for a week does not make me an important enough customer. No exceptions apparently.  No free WiFi! That is not acceptable in this day and age. I called the desk to find out how get the pay internet service on my laptop and tablet without having to pay twice. I was told the $12.00 was a per device charge and not a per
Manager Response: none

Summary: After searching around for the best hotels and best prices I decided to stay here. I got this off Priceline for around 80 something a night which wasn't bad at all. we stayed here in December for 2 nights for Xmas eve and Xmas. Right when you walk in, the lobby is in Christmas decor. This place looks really elegant. The rooms weren't too bad, pretty clean, however there is no microwave or kitchen area. There is wifi which you have to pay for. They also give you free delicious cookies at the front. The service was great. The free shuttle to Disneyland is also a plus which saves you money from disneyland parking. However they do charge for parking at the facility per night. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. I would stay here again and recommend to anyone else!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came back, AGAIN, for my birthday this time 1/06/12 for 3 days. We always stay here when we come to Disney or visit family. This hotel has the best EVERYTHING!!! Value, shuttle to disney, and just enough distance from the park to make it hassle free are just a few perks, it's the staff that puts this hotel over the top for us. Julio has been here almost each time we come and he always remembers us, no matter how long it has been. He is the friendliest, most helpful person with a great memory for sure. He is one of the reasons our family keeps coming back to this double tree. If you choose to stay here, make sure to say Hi to Julio for the Geers family, he'll be the one with the big smile running around the lobby and out front to make sure everyone is having a great stay;)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a couple of weeks with my wife and 2 kids for our Christmas family vacation in Orange County and were quite happy with our experience. Great customer service and overall cleanliness are the first things that stood-out. The free shuttle to Disney worked very well for us as it was running hourly and daily (and always on time). The breakfast menu (both for in-room dining or the buffet at Trofi) was quite good. The lunch and dinner menu looked very good, and appetizing, BUT did not taste as good and not worth the price. This was our only disappointment and this is why we decided to just eat supper somewhere else (restaurants in The Block of Orange, in Downtown Disney, or right across the street), unless we are really desperate of course. Overall, we loved our stay at
Manager Response: none

Summary: A hotel with top notch service and very reasonable prices!  The rooms are spacious.  The parking is convenient.  Starbucks just across the street, if one doesn't take advantage of the coffee/snack bar available for patronage inside the lobby.  Very friendly staff.  Far enough from Disneyland to avoid the big crowds, yet a free shuttle can have you there in a jiffy should you care to visit Mickey!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, clean rooms, and good location. Staff were always helpful, never a problem with service.  The room was always clean upon return each day, never anything out of place.  The location is very good if you need to visit the medical center.  It is also fairly close to Disney, The Block (an open air mall within a 5 minute walk; has a couple of decent restaurants – seafood and steak), and within ½ mile of Routes 5 and 57, and the airport (about 35 minutes non-rush hour).  Hotel has an onsite restaurant (breakfast w/buffet, lunch and dinner) and separate bar, pool and exercise room.  Caters to the business crowd.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed Christmas Eve visiting family.  From the time we checked in until we checked out Christmas Day, our stay was perfect!  Every staff person we came in contact with was very nice and ready to assist us.  Our room was very clean and spacious.  The continental breakfast that we chose had many items to choose from.  And I cannot forget the complimentary, most delicious warm chocolate chip cookies that were abundant.  The  hotel lobby was also beautifully decorated with the holiday theme.  We would highly recommend this hotel and we are looking forward to another stay in the future.  Hotel and staff deserve the highest marks possible.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel next the The Block
Summary: Nice location, friendly staff.  Comfortable room. There is a parking fee but no resort fee.  Double Tree cookies are awesome :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: took 2 grandchildren to Disneyland in October and stayed here.  nice,clean and no extra fees or resort fees that I have been hit with by other hotels.  nice pool and friendly shuttle service to Disneyland.  When I called and told them I needed a microwave and fridge in a 2 bed room - they did so without any added fees.  Very nice.  had my own broadband so wifi was no problem.  When will hotels understand that free wifi included in your room will bring added patrons?  would stay again.  I stay away from Disney area hotels...we always have the pool to ourselves and not a bunch of little kids running all over.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland & California Adventure. It's not close to the parks and by that I mean not walking distance but they have their own shuttle that is free that runs every hour. It's very close to The Outlets at Orange with all you would want for shopping and dining. Our room was clean and comfortable and I was given a view of the parks, they are distance away so I'm not sure how clearly you would see fireworks. I had no problem with noise of the freeway at all, occasionally I heard emergency vehicles because it's adjacent to a hospital. The pool area is clean, not sure of temperature because we did not use it, there is a beautiful Koi pond out there to sit by and enjoy a drink from their bar. We ordered room service and the food and service was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel but a little out of the way
Summary: Stayed here for a week.  Found the room really comfortable with fridge and microwave.  Bathroom was shower over bath, a little small but ok.  TV was flat screen and big.  The only drawback was a little out of the way if you want to go to LA.  They have a shuttle to Disneyland which was free and left on the hour, every hour.  Can really recommend Crystal Cathedral, just a few minutes walk up the road.  Amazing.statues and gardens.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Doubletree has the worst Customer Service
Summary: I was promised a "call back" within 48 hours to speak with a manager and never recieved it. I spent 3 hours on the phone with customer service willing to pay the $50 change fee, but they told me there was no more rooms available. All I wanted to do was shave two days off of my current reservation. How can there be no more rooms available when I already had a room reserved. I asked to speak to there manager, and with no avail, they never transferred me. Telling me the managers were all busy and couldn't help me even if I talked to them. When I agreed to recieve a "call back" it never came. I callled back and once again they said we will have our managers "call back". I informed them that they never called back before, why would they call back now. After waiting and calling 3 days
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I want to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced in your attempts to make changes to your reservation you described in your review A review which clearly indicates that we must further the education of certain employees as it relates to attention to detail and the practice of true customer service.    My sincere apologies for the fact that a team member failed to properly follow up with you in regard to your reservation. It causes me great concern when I hear of an instance when an employee has failed a guest. We attempt to impress upon the fact to our employees that there is no other task which takes precedence over the needs of a guest.   I would like to further speak with you in regards to service you received to investigate which outlet you took to make your reservation and make sure this type of occurrence does not happen again.   We look forward to hearing from you and to the opportunity to demonstrate our interest in you, as our valued client.  Victor Gonzalez Director of Rooms & Guest Services 714-634-7153 Doubletree by Hilton Anaheim-Orange County

Summary: Good hotel but a bit far from the Anaheim attractions. Close to Crystal Cathedral and Anaheim Stadium.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I got this hotel by chance through Priceline and was a little worried because it was so far from Disney land well a few miles anyways. They do have a free shuttle service every hours and it takes you right to the Disneyland entrance so you probably save on some walking.  The main drawback is the shuttle back and trying to decide if you can squeeze in one more ride or just wait a little longer.  I had never stayed at a 3 1/2 star hotel before so I was interested to see if I could recognize where the half star fits in.  For one thing the cookies are a nice touch, also the customer service was great everyone was friendly from the door to the shuttle drivers.  The shower had a large supply of hot water and I do mean hot, also we traveled with our three year old daughter and left
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean room, friendly service. The Block (an outdoor mall) is conveniently nearby.  There's a hospital across the street, so you do sometimes hear ambulance sirens. And two navigation systems (Google and Garmin) place the address on the back side of the hotel.  I would stay here again if I needed to visit the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was clean and the staff friendly but if staying here for a visit to Disneyland it isn't very convinient.  They do offer bus transport direct to DL but on the return numerous of our fellow travelers were left waiting for a second bus, after waiting 20 minutes for this one.  The rooms were a bit small for 3 adults, offering 2 double beds vs. 2 queen beds that would have been more comfortable.  There is a Starbucks directly across the street which is a nice benefit but overall I think there are better options for the price closer to the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rafael @ the bar is always quick with a drink and does an outstanding job.  Great food and service.  Always a pleasure to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed here several times because we have a son who attends a nearby university. It is our "go to" hotel any time we are visiting in this area. It's never disappointed us. Always clean and comfortable.  The one time we had an issue with a room, they moved us immediately, no questions asked and even upgraded us for our trouble. The prices are very reasonable for a hotel this nice, especially so close to Disneyland. You do have to pay for parking, but thats normal for a hotel of this caliber in this area. The front desk staff has always been very nice. Highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I just came back from a 4-day long weekend trip in Anaheim.  Our main goal is to visit Disneyland and its neighbor California Adventure Park. We chose Double Tree By Hilton because of the reasonable price, good location and the good reviews.   We paid $8 more per night to get the Executive King Room which is located on 14th floors and above with security access card and bathrobes. The room is spacious with microwave and fridge.  The bed is comfortable enough.  The hotel lobby comes with free wifi which is a bonus otherwise will have to pay for the in-room wifi service. The staff is very polite and helpful.  The bathroom is a bit small but clean and equipped with crabtree & evelyn toiletries.  The shower pressure is very good too.  Our room is also facing the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here in Oct, 2011 for only one night, as the matriarch of the family turned 90 and the hotel was only 15 minutes from her home and the party. Great service and staff, clean rooms, great view and property amenities. Close to Disneyland, related attractions and freeway access(not noisy). Multiple members of the family stayed here as well and the hotel was very accommodating; would stay again for sure.                               Michael P.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Comfortable beds, friendly, knowledgable staff.  Free shuttle to Disneyland, you do have to pay to park your car @ the hotel(standard for the area). Only down side was no fridge in the room
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went to check in .    Check in was VERY slow.  I saw others getting a water and a cookie.  We didnt get any.  We were using a discount coupon , so maybe a lower rate meant " No Cookie " .   The room is nice , bed is fine , shower had wonderful water pressure  ( also nice thick towels )  Also the Disneyland Shuttle driver was VERY and I mean VERY Nice.  Really had the Disney Attitude.  During our stay , as we went through the lobby there were people waiting to check in , for a LONG time.  Would have given this place a 5 rating but seeing check in slow,   not just for us but for others too , knocked it down to a four.
Manager Response: none

Summary: While not a 5 star hotel, the DT is a very nice upscale alternative to the typical mid-range hotel.  Rooms have an updated, modern motif; bed is super comfy and elegant, nice desk that two people can work from, fridge in room, etc.  The pool has the feel of a resort rather than a mid-range hotel.  Service was excellent.  All in all, a good deal.  Only negative - no included breakfast vs. say, a Hampton.  But a good tradeoff.  Drive to Old Town Orange and eat at one of their quaint and unique restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel thru PriceLine, name your own price and got a slammin' deal!  We stayed two nites in a great room with super comfy beds! We purchased tickets at the front desk for Disneyland and took the shuttle to the park (10 minute drive). Great staff, very clean, would stay again.  You get a warm cookie when you check in, problem is they are so good you want more!!!  Great for families, pool, restaurants, shuttle, buffet, Wendy's , Starbucks, Quizno's across the street!  Thanks Doubletree and can you send me the receipe!! :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights last week.  We discovered this location via a winning bid on Priceline.  We chose Disneyland North and were hoping for something closer.  It's convenient enough though as we had a Disney parking pass.  I would not want to rely on the shuttle as it only runs hourly. We checked in late on a Tuesday night and the staff was very friendly.  I asked for a room with a view and we got a lovely one on the 8th floor - just in time to have a perfect view of the Disney fireworks.  The beds were very comfy and it's a nice place to stay.  There's just a lot of equally nice, if not better, places closer to Disney if that's what you're looking for.  I was apprehensive when I read that this was a pet friendly hotel.  I stayed at one before and it smelled like wet dogs
Manager Response: none

Summary: The lobby is inviting & gives the hotel a relaxed atmosphere. The staff was friendly, greeting us when we came or went. We called ahead to request a room on a low floor & they noted our account. We had a room with a comfy king bed, work table, a lounging chair & flat screen tv. There was plenty of space in the room for our stuff & baby gear even after we put up the pack & play.    Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the freeway. It was a bit noisy but not terrible & I wish you could open a window for some fresh air. Our room seemed stuffy even with the air running the entire time. Summary: The hotel was hard to drive into. There is only one way in and one way out, and there are one-way and no-U turn roads all over the place so until you get the hang of it, you will drive around some. The hotel itself is a decent business hotel. The room was well appointed and clean. I am a stickler for shower pressure and noise. My shower had great pressure and I didn't hear a neighbor even once, so two thumbs up on both of those accounts.   I didn't get a cookie. :-(  It was an otherwise good experience, except for the lady working in the convenience shop who was somewhat rude and dismissive each time I went down to get something.

Summary: I always look at value hotels with a bit of anxiety because I like the services and amenities 4 and 5 star properties offer. Walking into this Doubletree, you think you are walking into a Waldorf hotel. Large lobby, open space and attentive staff. At check-in they give you a warm chocolate chip cookie and breakfast voucher for a full breakfast (very nice with omelet station).   The rooms are updated and acceptable for the price. Good bed, decent shower.   They have a very nice bar and restaurant which is a huge plus for a value hotel. They even serve complimentary snacks.   The downside: Don't plan on working out as the fitness room is smaller than the bedroom and very disappointing. The outdoor pool is OK for drinking Bud Lights but too small for laps. There is an outdoor spa.

Summary Heading: Nice for a business hotel - but internet and cell coverage poor
Summary: I was at the hotel because a conference I was attending was being held there.  This hotel was a nice example of a Doubletree, but I found the internet fee was not only high, but, after paying for it it did not work elsewhere in the hotel outside of my room.  This was a disappointment, as I had thought I could use it during the day while attending the conference.  Further, the cell coverage was poor, so my personal hotspot did not work, either.   On the plus side, the food I received from room service and for the hosted luncheon event was some of the better mid-range hotel food I have experienced lately.  All the service personnel I encountered were friendly and helpful, without being over the top.

Summary: I stayed here on a Priceline reservation, and was really impressed.  My room was very well appointed.  Flat screen tv, granite counters in the bathroom, and the furnishings all felt new. When Priceline gave me this hotel I was thinking it'd be really far out from Disneyland - but it's actually perfectly located.  You can avoid the mess on Harbor Blvd by just taking I-5 a few exits down, and the hotel is immediately off the highway.  I did not use the shuttle, but it is free and is privately run

Summary Heading: Excellent value and walking distance to Angels Stadium
Summary: I booked the room for a concert at Angels Stadium and picked this hotel for the proximity and price. The location was excellent for the show. Lobby has a Starbucks which is always a nice option instead of the instant coffee in the room. The staff was very helpful in providing directions to the stadium, which turned out to be a quick 20 minute walk. The bed was very comfortable. My only complaint is that the bar did not handle the busy late night crowd very well being under staffed. Many people were getting frustrated by the wait. Not only was the concert crowd there, a wedding crowd also was there. If I'm in the area again, I will definitely stay here again.

I booked the room about 3 weeks prior to the trip and asked for two adjoining rooms. When we arrived, we did not have adjoining rooms, we were on separate floors which kind of messed up some plans for adults to be able to go out on their own when kids were asleep. Also, although I felt like my room was away from the elevator, I heard the elevator going up and down until I fell asleep. It was actually kind of loud. Summary Heading: Average hotel in Anaheim Los Angeles

The business rooms were nice and the food laid on for the business event was quite good. An outdoor shopping mall within 10 minutes walk had some good restaurants. Nothing much to do in the area if you are not there for Disney stuff.
Manager Response: Guest service & cleanliness is our number one goal here at the Doubletree by Hilton. The one complaint I have is the double beds. While they were comfortable, they were much too small for two adults. We had to squish due to the number of people in our party, so we didn't get much sleep, but the good definitely outweighed the bad, overall.  One and a half thumbs up from me!
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you're looking for a safe, clean, affordable place to stay, this will do.  My wife and I were just passing through on the Interstate and decided to stay here.  We booked on Priceline, which got us an incredible deal.  We didn't mind paying for parking obviously, because it was only an extra $13 on top of what we paid.  The room was comfy, a little out-dated I would say for sure.  But we really weren't looking for a trendy place to stay.  We wanted someplace we felt safe staying at, and we found it.  The cookie wasn't all that great, but it was still a nice try.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I got this hotel via Priceline and was pleased with the general services, room facilities and location.  I did not have a car, so the parking fee was not an issue.  Some reviewers commented on the cost of the wifi - but this is only in room.  There was free wifi connections in the lobby area, which I had no problems with connecting my laptop.  Also, there is a business center which has 3 computers and printers with free internet access.  I used the business center to print out my boarding passes.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value hotel, conveniently located for Disney & shopping
Summary: Excellent service - cookie on arrival was a nice touch and yummy to boot.  Rooms a little dated but roomy, clean and well equipped though there was no fridge or safe.  Safety deposit box available free of charge they are small (unable to fit netbook in it) and this is not as convenient.  There is a charge for WiFi, with no mention of charges in literature or communal areas having WiFi connectivity.  Very conveniently located for Disney and shopping centre with cinema & bowling within walking distance.

Summary: Booked this on priceline for $41 night and thought it was well worth it.  Hotel is old but decent for the price.  The $13 parking fee is annoying but they all seem to charge that now.  The cookies at check in were delicious.  We would definitely stay here again if going to Disneyland since it was close.  Only negative we can say is that they were out of cribs so our baby had to sleep in his car seat.  Beds were comfy and they do allow pets!

One thing I did not like was the parking fee p/night ($13.00)!  There is also a 24-hr charge for WIFI!  Those were added expenses that make the total cost not worth the price, esp because this hotel is on the older side.  We stayed a total of 3 nights.  We had to move rooms once b/c the floors/carpet were filthy!  Our feet turned black, we asked to move, but the next room was no better, but a slight improvement.  The carpet was old, looks like orginal carpeting.  The size of the rooms were ok, and the beds were good too (but small)--it would have been nice to have a large king.  The bathroom was ok and had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable, and Convenient for Disney vacation
Summary: We booked a room through Hotwire and this was the hotel assigned to us. I wasn't sure what to expect as I wasn't too familiar with the area but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the cookies upon arrival, Neutrogena toiletries, comfortable beds, free internet access, and free shuttle to Disneyland. We were surprised by the $13 per night parking fee which brought the price of the room up to the the cost of those across the street from Disneyland. We ate at the breakfast buffet at the hotel once and found it to be pretty picked over. The orange juice was empty and when I asked for a glass the waiter was rude to me and took about a half an hour to bring me one. That incident aside, this is a nice hotel and we would recommend it
Manager Response: none

Summary: The front desk staff was very nice and thoughtful. I booked one room on Priceline, then later booked another room also on Priceline for my friend. The hotel noticed the same name on two reservations so they assigned connecting rooms. When we checked in we requested two beds for each room so they reassigned us the rooms we want. There were refrigerator and microwave oven in the room. It was a nice surprise because I thought we have to pay extra to have these. Oh they also gave everybody warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked in.  Shuttle to Disney is big and very punctual. First shuttle is at 7:30am then on the hour after that. They leave right on time so come down early.
