Summary: The room was very clean & spacious. The bed was so comfy I wish I could have taken it home with me. The view from the 19th floor was fantastic. The warm Choc Chip Cookies that you receive on arrival just melt in your mouth and are to die for. The hotel was wonderfully decorated for Christmas, something you don't see too much of in Australia. The staff were exceptional, friendly, extremely helpful and the service was impecable. I was a solo traveller and I felt safe in and around the hotel. The staff were very good in providing advice about where to go and how to stay safe. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Anaheim. Shopping, restaurants & transport at your door.

The service was excellent - they have a customer service counter right when you walk in who were always there willing to give tips to excel your stay in Orange County. Self parking is $13.00/day or Valet for $15.00/day.  There is a business center which has desktop computers and printers with internet access for free.  Wireless internet available for $9.95 per 24 hours, or $24.95 for 3 days.  There is a shuttle which
Manager Response: none

The valet, doorman, security guard, concierge and customer service person all greeted us with a genuine smile.  The man that checked us in explained all their services to us and even gave us two freshly baked cookies that my boyfriend immediately enjoyed.  YUM. The rooms are very well maintained and very predictably comfortable. Beds are always clean and crisp.  Service at this place is top notch as well.  One day during this visit we walked from our room to the parking lot and past 5 hotel employees along the way, every single one smiled and said good morning to us in passing. Some 5 star hotels don’t even have that kind of dedicated employees.  Also, one of the front desk guys always says welcome back to us every time we

The rooms are very small & we even had an excecutive room. The bathroom is VERY small & barely enough room for one person. I've stayed in many Doubletree hotels & this is by far the worst! If reading this review, I totally recommend staying somewhere else.

It felt a little melodramatic but we got what we asked for. Summary: I've stayed here numerous times over the past 15 years and have come to appreciate how well maintained this property is. However for this Christmas trip I felt the AAA discounted price of approximately $85 per night to be a good deal.   During my most recent stay, the bathroom was not as clean as it should have been. I found hair on the floor which should have been detected by housekeeping, and the back of the bathroom door had not been cleaned recently judging by the splash marks on it.   Service is fine. Instead of staying at the hotels right next to Disney we would consider staying here on our next Disney trip.

They offer a complimentary shuttle that picked us up at the top of the hour each hour until night fall and then it was very 30 minutes.  Right behind the hotel (it's walking distance) is The Block, it's your average outdoor mall filled with restaurants and shops. Manager Response: none

So I did without the in-room wireless, taking my laptop to the lobby to check email (there is also a complimentary business center), and declined the refrigerator when I called ahead to query about the room.  When we were checked in (which was plenty quick), they initially put us on the 4th floor, and when I asked for a higher room so that we could see the fireworks at night, we ended up with a room with fridge and micro anyway! And ended up seeing the fireworks from our 11th-story windows two of the four nights--magical. Absolutely magical.  I

Summary Heading: The poorest Hilton Property you'll find.

Our room was old and run down, not newly renovated like they claim. The towels were damp hanging on the towel bar. The bed had hair in it and smelled moldy. We called for clean towels, they brought us 4 towels two with dried baby poop on them. WAIT IT GETS BETTER, This was on the "EXECUTIVE LEVEL" in a "Premium Room". This hotel is absolutely sickening. When I expressed my concerns to the "Guest Services Manager" in the morning her exact words to me were "Sir, we are fine hotel". No appology, no gosh why did this happen, can we do something to fix it, but SIR WE ARE A FINE HOTEL! We had a 4 night reservation and left the

Summary: Was in Anaheim labor day weekend for a volleyball tournament.  Stay at the Doubletree and was very impressed with the hotel.  It is in the same parking lot as a mall so there entertainment and food with walking distance.  Stayed only one night.  The check in was a little slow, but once we got checked in it was great!  They gave us milk chocolate cookies at check in.  The room was large, clean, and modern.  Quiet!  I did not hear any of the noise outside.  There is a pool but it was very small and crowded.  The beds are very comfortable.  Can not advise on the distance to Disneyland because I did not go to Disneyland.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great room at a great price
Summary: The Doubletree was fantastic value for money. The room was clean, a good size and modern. The hotel had a great buffet breakfast and cafe.  The Doubletree was in walking distance from Disneyland. Staff were friendly and helpful. There was also ample parking for guests.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights around a trip to Disney. Great location with ample parking at $11 per day. The pool was very busy and small for the size of the hotel.   Shuttle bus to Disney stops outside the resort ($3) or you can drive in around 5 mins and pay the $12 per car to Disney,  The hotel is clean and the beds comfortable after a long day at Disney. There are ample restaurants around the area.   For the cost this is great value and a great location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel but not convenient to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Not terribly convenient for a conference attendee (the hotel shuttle to Disneyland and ACC only runs once an hour) and if you're visiting Disneyland, it works better to have a car (which I did).  However, the location is convenient for other sights (Crystal Cathedral, baseball games) and is just off I-5 exit so  very easy to get on/off freeway.  My room was on the 11th-floor, north side.  Although I was three miles away from DL, was able to see the fireworks from my hotel room (I'd recommend asking for a disney view).  I was surprised to see both a mini-fridge *and* a microwave in my room (not typical of Doubletree's).  King bed was quite comfortable and had *8* pillows!  In room wireless is $12/day
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just arrived home from a 4 night stay at the Doubletree Hotel in Orange, and wanted to add my impressions of this hotel.  We checked in with ease, got our cookies, and went to our  room.  We booked a 2 double bed room for 2 adults and a 4 year old, and it looked like the hotel website.   The beds were comfortable but quite high off the floor, so we got a rollaway bed for our 4 year old in case she fell out of the bed.  The bathroom was also pretty standard, with tile floor, marble sink and tub surround, but what was a pleasant surprise was the drawer in the bathroom vanity to get your beauty stuff off the counter. The hotel uses Neutrogena shampoo, conditioner, and soap, but also had body lotion and small tubes of face cream with SPF 30, an nice touch before going out in sunny
Manager Response: none

Summary: A friend and I were invited to a wedding in the city of Orange. The wedding party had blocked a number of rooms for those who wanted to stay over. We decided to make this a mini vacation staying two nights. The wedding was beautiful and our stay at the Doubletree was great. The rooms were large,very clean and comfortable. The staff members were very attentive. There was always someone greeting us as we entered the hotel or leaving it. We found the hotel quiet,so sleeping was undisturbed. We really enjoyed our stay here and recommened it to anyone staying in the area. The area is interesting filled with all types of activities from some good eating to taking in a movie or an Angel Game.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Doubletree is as good as its cookies!
Summary: We got the Doubletree off Hotels.com, which offered a terrific rate for the Memorial Day weekend. We selected a nonsmoking room on a high floor, and got exactly that. Robert at the front desk was full of aloha and helped us get into our room with the utmost efficiency. My husband couldn't believe we were on the 14th floor for the rate we paid! Even better, we had the Doubletree's delicious chocolate chip cookies to enjoy while we watched the free HBO on the Sweet Dreams bed. (I really needed the rest as I had to recover from the crush at Knott's Berry Farms. I got bodychecked in line for the Ghostrider!!!) Great job on the renovation, Doubletree! The chain really does deserve those hip commercials!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked through Priceline and got a decent rate.  (About 40% under rates on the Doubletree web site.)  As always when using Priceline, we called prior to our arrival to insure we got the type of room and bed we wanted.  Entrance to the hotel while driving is a bit confusing, but once you get used to it, it is okay.  (Although the hotel is clearly visible from the street, the entrances are past the hotel on either side.)  The room was good sized and the bed confortable.  The room had a good-sized refrigerator and a microwave oven which would be very handy for longer stays.  The only major problem was the air conditioning system which never adequately cooled the room.  (At night, the room was stuffy.)  The hotel is quite a distance from Disneyland.  The hotel does provide a

Summary: We arrived at this hotel late in the evening, around 11:30 pm.  At first my daughter and I were assigned to a smoking room.  After calling to the front desk, we got another room.  Ramona searched high and low of a room for us, and was really helpful.   Our room had a great view of the San Gabriel Mountains, downtown LA, Century City and Disneyland.  We booked through priceline, but that was never mentioned and we never felt like we were treated any differently because we wanted to save some money on this trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked two connecting rooms for 3 nights during spring break, March 24-27 2008. Check in was fast and courteous. My only disappointment was that the second room wasn't ready and we had to wait over an hour for housekeeping to finish. Rooms were large, clean and supplied with all the usual necessities. The beds, and especially the pillows, were very comfortable. The restaurant was decent, but nothing special. The bellman was helpful and was able to get our party last minute reservations to Medieval Times. The hotel runs a shuttle to and from Disneyland that runs from every half hour to hour from about 7:30am until midnight. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After staying 2 nightsat the Anaheim Marriott at company expense, I decided to stay here for $110/night (concierge floor), rather than extend my stay at the Marriott for $240/night (plus $20 a day parking).  I enjoyed almost everything better about my stay here--and not just the price!  The room was bigger.  The desk was larger and more comfortable to work on.  The view was nicer (I asked for and received a Crystal Cathedral view room the day before).  Guests were not charged for parking while I was there (but sometimes they do charge $13/d).  A buffet breakfast was free.  The landscaping was nicer.  The room had a free fridge and microwave (and bathrobe).  The only things better at the Marriott were the lobby and the slightly larger (but more awkwardly-shaped) pool.   The rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was very clean.  Staff was great.  Cookies were always warm and wonderful.  Every time we asked for one we got it.  The hotel's pool and fitness room were nice.  They also have tennis, basketball and volleyball courts.  It was .3 miles (five minute walk to The Block which had 32 movie theatres and many restaurants.  Shopping was geared more to 30 and under).  Cystal Cathedral was 1/2 mile away.  They had a shuttle to Disneyland.  When we stayed there were very few families at the property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I only stayed here one night, but it was so nice I had to write a review. The room was very clean and updated. It was the bed that made this room - really comfortable and even the sheets smelled good! And who can resist a warm chocolate chip cookie when checking in? Don't fret about the $10 parking fee and $10 internet fee, my understanding is that most LA hotels charge the same, if not more. I didn't use any of the hotel's amenities, like restaurant (there are many close by). The front desk staff could not have been nicer. Nice job Doubletree!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of 6 stayed here between 10 and 13 December, 2007, mostly just as a base to visit Disneyland.  Wonderful experience, with the hotel staff happy to give the kids cookies every day (when we stayed at DB in NYC a week later they were very strict about only giving them at check in, and charging thereafter !), the rooms being clean and spacious and free use of the internet in the business centre.   Happy, friendly staff; big, clean well appointed rooms; this was a great base to visit Disneyland from. The restaurant at the Sheraton a couple of blocks away was also a great place for dinner.

Summary Heading: Good out of the way hotel for a conference

Even though our room window faced Hwy 5, it was nice an quiet inside.  Beds were comfortable.  The room did have a funny orange scented cleaner smell every time we stepped inside but you stop noticing it after a couple of minutes.   The staff at the front desk were very nice and professional.  Same goes for the security people at the front door.  The warm fresh baked cookie we received at check-in was a nice touch. Summary: We went to a Halloween party down in Irvine and decided to use our Hilton Honors points for a free one-night stay.  Since it only cost us a total of $10 for parking, it's hard to complain but nothing really stood out other than the location.  It's right off the 5 freeway and very easy to find, right next to the Block at Orange, close to Anaheim Stadium (or whatever it's called now), the Honda Center, and Disneyland.  The main reason we picked the hotel was the location and it couldn't be better.  We stayed on the 7th floor and the room was nice.  Had a king bed and a somewhat plain feel but since we didn't even check in until after midnight we didn't need too much.  The bed was comfortbable. Summary: We stayed at the Doubletree for two nights on a trip to Disneyland.  Out party consisted of my wife, our 1.5 y/o and me.  I booked through the Hilton Honors website and this was a reward stay for us.  Outside Appearance/Location: The outside of the Doubletree was spotless.  There is bell service at the loading/front door area if needed and parking is in an open lot right out front which is very convenient to get to (Parking is $10/night just like every other Doubletree.  Room rates seem to be slightly lower compared to other Hilton brands due to this). Sitting right next to 1-5, the hotel is two exits south of the Disneyland Resort.  There is a shopping center with fast food options right across the street.  Both the Crystal Cathedral and Angel Stadium are in viewing distance.

Summary: We just returned from a family trip to California.  We stayed at 3 different hotels during our trip.  We stayed at the Doubletree for one night so we could take our daughter and a friend to Disneyland.  The Doubletree was nicely appointed, and the front desk was very friendly (the best experience on our trip).  We were all treated to warm gourmet cookies upon arrival.  They run a shuttle to Disneyland (about 2 miles away) every hour, so there isn't a need to park and walk/pay parking fees.  The room was nice and clean - the bathroom was clean, but small (although the bathrooms in all the hotels we stayed at were small).  We booked through Priceline, so the price was good.  If you're going to Disneyland or staying in the Anaheim area, I would recommend a stay at the Doubletree.

Summary: This hotel is beautiful!  From the moment we walked in we were impressed.  There is plenty of parking right in front of the hotel and the valet are very helpful in unloading your bags, and allowing you to park right in front while you check-in.  Check-in went smoothly we were given a room on the 9th floor with two double beds.  The room was very nice.  This is the first hotel that I have stayed in that the carpet is actually soft.  The bathroom was medium in size and very nice.  The view from our room was great it overlooked Angels Stadium.    The shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland was great.  The only draw back was that it would have been nice for it to be more frequent.  Once an hour isn't much.  However Valerie was awesome because she would come and pick us up anytime we

Summary: The Doubletree is modern and clean and comfortable.  The beds are some of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in.  The shower had great water pressure and the bathroom was very clean. The view from the room was nice.  The staff is friendly and doesn't keep you waiting. This was our second stay at this location and the only complaints I can think of were the limited parking and distance from the hotel, and the hotel often has business travelers who are loud and obnoxious in the late night hours.

Summary: Stayed here one night in June. We were in town for an Angels game. This property EXCEEDED my expectations. Honestly one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything from top to bottom felt new and plush.  Cookies at check-in  - how can you not love that? Our room was spotless. The property is walking distance to the The Block @ Orange and to Angels Stadium. Just keep in mind, some people view 'walking distance' differently than others. I would say it was about a 20 minute walk to the shopping and maybe closer to 30 minutes to the stadium (just shy of a mile). I had no problem with this walk, but others might find it to be a bit too far. I would stay here again in a second.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel while on business in Orange County.  I had enjoyed a stay there a few years ago and trusted the Doubletree name. The next morning, I was up bright and early to get ready for my day.  I pulled back the shower curtain and found a pool of brown sludge about an inch deep in my shower. My apologies never the less. Respectfully, Jeff Morse General Manager

Summary: Stayed for one night on business during the week of May 21, 2007.  Hotel was much nicer than most Doubletrees I've stayed at before.  Room was spacious, clean (except the curtains) and quiet.  Newer TV in the room.  Microwave and refrigerator appeared new as well.  As a Hilton Honors member, you can enjoy the executive lounge for free appetizers and breakfast.  Although you still must pay for drinks in the executive lounge, they did provide a free drink coupon.  There was a photo shoot going on at the pool all week (?) so if you wanted to use a pool, you could go across the street to a pretty dumpy looking hotel and use theirs.  No thanks!  Adequate business center with free internet, printing & photocopying.  I would stay there again if in the area.

Summary: Our stay at the Doubletree went better than planned! :)  CHECK-IN: Upon arriving, the staff upgraded our room and gave us some yummy-tasting cookies (or so I'm told--I didn't actually try them.  The person staying with me did though.  The cookies had nuts in the them and I don't like nuts.  Knowing that there are nuts inside is very important to any of you who have nut allergies--be forewarned!)  OUR VIEW: Our view was spectacular!  So many beautiful city lights surrounded our room.  The only drawback was that I think that there might have been a hospital nearby, because we heard ambulances drive by a few times during the night.   THE ROOM: Nice sized (much bigger than I thought that it would be).  We got a room with 2 double beds.  There was a table with 2 chairs and another

I have used priceline on numerous occasasion in the past, and I certainly understand that booking through priceline only guarantees a room which will sleep two adults.  However, up until now I have never encountered a problem with the higher star rated hotels accommodating my requests.   I was very disappointed with the unprofessional attitude of the staff member at the registration area who grudgingly placed us in a non-smoking room with two double beds.  This was surprising as I was told at the time of booking and again when I called the morning of our arrival, that the hotel would be able to honor my request.  Unfortunately this individual, whose shift was ending, felt the need to remind me in a not-so- nice

Summary: Hi All,   We won this hotel during Easter week with  a 55.00 bid on Priceline.  We were very happy with the price paid for the accomodations.  The rooms were very nice and the beds were fantastic.   It is a few miles to Disney, so no walking is not an option, which makes this a less desirable location, but the hotel does offer a free shuttle to the theme parks.  We only stayed here one night before checking into a Disneyland Resort Hotel,  so I will keep this review short, just like our stay.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay!  Great location and surprise guests!!!
Summary: I was lucky to have booked this hotel via Priceline for $60 per night!  I would have paid triple that price and still been happy!  I think a few of the previous reviews are for the Doubletree Suites in Anaheim, closer to Disney.  This hotel is about 2.5 miles from Disneyland but the hourly shuttle is GREAT!!    I had a regular room with a king sized bed on the 12th floor.  I could watch the fireworks from Disneyland from my hotel room windows!  The room and hotel were very clean.  The restaurant and room service EXCELLENT!!  The staff were very helpful.  The concierge helped to book a bus tour of LA/Hollywood at the last minute.  It was a blast!  He also let me in on a little secret.  The Texas Rangers were staying at the hotel while they were in town to play the Angels..  After
Manager Response: none

Summary: After searching for several places online, we found the Doubletree to have some availability for our Spring Break at Disneyland.  The hotel is located one exit South of Disneyland so is not within walking distance.  The hourly shuttle service to and from Disneyland was very convenient and drops you off pretty much at the entrance.    We (two adults, two kids) spent four nights here.  Our experience was pleasant.  We got a nice clean room with double beds.  The fluffy pillows were great.  It was quiet so we all got rest each night.   Anyone wanting to go to Disneyland, I would recommend staying here and would come back for future visits.  Overall, I was pleased with our stay here. I was surprised with the $10/day parking but figured that was offset by the parking I would have had

Summary: Stayed here for 1 night in Feb 2007.  Very nice hotel, stayed on the club level floor and the free breakfast is a good perk.  Food was much more than a typical continental one.   I was in Anaheim on a quick business trip, but the location is good for site seeing or nighttime entertainment at the Block at Orange next door to the hotel.  Would definitely stay here again, close to all the Anaheim attractions and good business location right off the freeway.

Summary: Spent the weekend with this hotel.  Nice hotel but the service could have been improved. This sort of thing happened all weekend......including housekeeping.  We finally had good service upon checkout........thanks to the bell boy.

Summary: The hotel was quiet and a great retreat after a long day at Disney.  The beds were very comfortable and I especially enjoyed the down comforters and pillows.  The walk to Disney is comparable to six city blocks.  But our three kids were able to make the trip.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disney, large room
Summary: Stayed here on a multi-day (6 night) visit to Disneyland.  Less than 1 mile to Disney with resonable ($8/day) parking.  We booked as part of a Costco package, so the hotel cost us ~$125/night which was well worth it.  No complimentary breakfast (we bought bagels/cereal at the Target down the road).  Parking was easy and we had an easy ~10 minute walk to the park.  Hotel staff was very helpful and the room was very quiet.  The pool looked very nice/clean, but due to cold weather we never used it.

There are a microwave and mini fridge that we found very useful. Bathroom is on the small side with the vanity inside, but clean. The only problem we had was the loud air-conditioning unit.  The hotel is only one block from The Block and we had a good lunch at the corner cafe there before heading to Disneyland. The hotel location is good as well, only 10 minutes or less to Disneyland.  Parking is $10 as stated on the hotel website. No other

I find it annoying that they don't tell you about the parking fees up front.

Summary: We booked two nights at the Doubletree through priceline.com. It was around $50 a night which was a fantastic deal.   The hotel was about a five to seven minute drive to the convention center or Disney, but they also offer a free shuttle to/from Disney which was very convenient for us to use.  The front desk staff was very polite and treated us wonderfully, even giving us extra cookies and free parking. FYI, parking there is usually $8 for self-park or $10 for valet. Summary: Meets my three important criteria: quiet, comfortable, and clean.  The beds were fantastic, the rooms nice and comfortable (nothing special) and the hotel staff efficient and friendly.  The lobby is spacious, simple, and elegent. BTW, there is a fantastic, fun shopping mall (City Block) right next to the hotel and overall, a super convenient location.

I stayed at this hotel in August of 2006 and choose it because of it's proxmity to Angel Stadium.  Rate: $125.10 AAA/$138.00 with tax  Service: I arrived at the hotel early, (Around 12:30pm), and was happily checked in. I was informed that the room I chose on the Hilton Online checkin system (Gold & Diamond HHonors only) was not available, but, instead I was put on in a room 8 floors higher (which I preferred). Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland visits
Summary: We just returned from our mini-vacation to Disneyland. The Doubletree Hotel was a wonderful choice (via Priceline). They provide free shuttle service to/from Disneyland starting one half hour before the park opens (7:30AM) and every hour on the top of the hour. The return shuttle service starts at 2:15PM and picks up every hour on the quarter hour up to 15 minutes after the park closes. They were on time every day.    The room seemed small for our three person family (two adults/one child). The bathroom could have been a bit larger. It would have been nice if the shower and toilet were separate from the wash basin to allow for getting ready quicker.  There are no queen beds (according to the front desk person). Summary: I booked this hotel thru hotwire $70.00 a night, the room was great they have the best beds!!!!.  i stayed here with a toddler, we used the shuttle for disneyland they leave on the hour to the park and fifteen minutes after the hour they pick up at the park do not be late they were always on time. Summary: This is a nice high rise hotel with pretty rooms, nice people, and reasonable prices.  The furniture in my room was fairly new and attractive, if not ornate. Summary: I was a little hesitant to visit the Doubletree after reading a few average reviews. But our family visit was wonderful. After a mix up with our room (we expected a double with a fold out couch) we ended up with two double rooms, free breakfast buffet for 5 and free parking for the price of a single room. The service is wonderful - the staff quickly got to know our family and we felt right at home. The rooms are clean and of high quality - parking is easy and the free shuttle to Disney was a welcome surprise. The location is great - 2 miles from Disney and far enough away to avoid mobs and just a block from The Block - great shopping, dining, movies, bowling, arcades and more. Our family loved it and would visit again in a heartbeat!
